Package com.wallstft.sftp.server

Class SftpServerImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wallstft.sftp.server.SftpServerImpl
  • public class SftpServerImpl
extends java.lang.Object
    The SftpServerImpl class is used to setup a Sftp Server.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected static int port
      The port value has a default of 21555 but can be overwritten using the setPort() function.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SftpServerImpl()

      addUser() adds a users to the SSH server and specifies the home-directory and public-key.

      removeUser() will remote the specified user from the server.

    • Field Detail

      • port

        protected static int port
        The port value has a default of 21555 but can be overwritten using the setPort() function.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SftpServerImpl

    • Method Detail

      • getPort

        public static int getPort()

      • setPort

        public static void setPort​(int p)
        Use setPort() to override the default port value of 21555
        Parameters:
        p - the new port number used to override the default.

      • start_server

        public void start_server​(SftpKeyAuthenicatorImpl auth)
        Parameters:
        auth - contains the actions that configures the server. auth.getPasswordAuthenticator - This is used to determine the configuration for users logging in using passwords. auth.getPublicKeyAuth - This is used to determine the configuration for users using publickKey authentication. auth.getHostKeyProvider - This is used to specify the storage of the host-key.

      • addUser

        public void addUser​(java.lang.String username,
                    java.lang.String home_directory,
                    java.security.PublicKey public_key)
        addUser() adds a users to the SSH server and specifies the home-directory and public-key.
        Parameters:
        username - add this user to the user.
        home_directory - this user will have this home-directory when connected to the SSH server.
        public_key - this is the public-key that the server will used to authenticate the users.

      • removeUser

        public void removeUser​(java.lang.String username)
        removeUser() will remote the specified user from the server.
        Parameters:
        username - the user to be removed from the SSH server.
